attrs.description: Caption of the chart.
attrs.name: caption

attrs.description: Sub-caption of the chart.
attrs.name: subCaption

description: Using these attributes, you can set the various headings and titles of chart like caption, sub-caption.

attrs.description: Sets horizontal alignment of caption
attrs.name: captionAlignment

attrs.description: Whether caption should be on top of the data plot area
attrs.name: captionOnTop

attrs.description: Sets the caption font size in pixels
attrs.name: captionFontSize

attrs.description: Sets the sub-caption font size (in pixels)
attrs.name: subCaptionFontSize

attrs.description: Sets the caption font family
attrs.name: captionFont

attrs.description: Sets the sub-caption font family
attrs.name: subCaptionFont

attrs.description: Sets the caption font color
attrs.name: captionFontColor

attrs.description: Sets the sub-caption font color
attrs.name: subCaptionFontColor

attrs.description: Whether the caption font should be displayed in bold
attrs.name: captionFontBold

attrs.description: Whether the sub caption font should be displayed in bold
attrs.name: subCaptionFontBold

attrs.description: Whether the caption is aligned with the canvas. Else, it will be aligned with the entire chart area
attrs.name: alignCaptionWithCanvas

attrs.description:
If caption is not centre aligned, lets you configure the padding (in pixels) from either edge.
Will be ignored if caption is centre aligned.
attrs.name: captionHorizontalPadding

description: These attributes let you configure the cosmetics of chart caption and sub-caption.

attrs.description: This attribute lets you set the configuration whether the chart should appear in an animated fashion. If you do not want to animate any part of the chart, set this as 0.
attrs.name: animation

attrs.description:
This attribute sets the animation duration of the chart. `animationDuration` attribute is applicable only if animation of the chart is enabled. 

Default value: 1 sec
attrs.name: animationDuration

attrs.description: The entire chart can now act as a hotspot. Use this URL to define the hotspot link for the chart. The link can be specified in FusionCharts link format.
attrs.name: clickURL

attrs.description: Each chart has 5 pre-defined color palettes which you can choose from. Each palette renders the chart in a different color theme.
attrs.name: palette

attrs.description: If you want your own palette derived from a particular hex color, you can specify the same here. All other colors on the chart will automatically derive from that palette.
attrs.name: paletteThemeColor

attrs.description: If you've defined the chart parameters (like gauge origin, co-ordinates etc.) using a different chart size and now want to scale the chart to a different size, you need to specify the original width and height and then set this attribute to 1.
attrs.name: autoScale

attrs.description: Setting this attribute to 1, you can allow the chart to automatically resize itself when the parent container of the chart is resized. This setting is not applicable when `autoScale` is set to `0`.
attrs.name: manageResize

attrs.description: If you've opted to dynamically resize the chart, you can convey the original width of chart using this attribute. It refers to the width based on which you had defined the various co-ordinates/radius of the gauge. For example, if you had designed a gauge with 300 px width and in that you had set the bulb radius to be 50, then you can use the dynamic resizing feature and specify `origW='300'`. It will automatically check the current width and scale the bulb radius etc. appropriately. Please note that both the original width and height of the chart need to be set. To know more on how this attribute works, please read Angular Gauge > Dynamic Resizing page.
attrs.name: origW

attrs.description: If you've opted to dynamically resize the chart, you can convey the original height of chart using this attribute. It refers to the height based on which you had defined the various co-ordinates/radius of the gauge. For example, if you had designed a gauge with 300 px height and in that you had set the bulb radius to be 50, then you can use the dynamic resizing feature and specify `origH='300'`. It will automatically check the current height and scale the bulb radius etc. appropriately. Please note that both the original width and height of the chart need to be set. To know more on how this attribute works, please read Angular Gauge > Dynamic Resizing page.
attrs.name: origH

attrs.description: Whether to show chart's value?
attrs.name: showValue

attrs.description: Whether to use gradient fill for the thermometer?
attrs.name: use3DLighting

attrs.description: Whether to show "Print Chart" item in the context menu of the chart? Even if you opt to hide the item in context menu, you can still opt to invoke `print()` JavaScript method of the chart to print the same.
attrs.name: showPrintMenuItem

attrs.description: By default, the real-time charts wait for a few seconds after rendering for the first time and before updating itself with new data. To allow the chart to start updating itself as soon as it is rendered, set this attribute to 1.
attrs.name: refreshInstantly

attrs.description: When enabled in AUTO mode, long data labels are truncated by adding ellipses to prevent them from overflowing the chart background. The default value is 1.
attrs.name: useEllipsesWhenOverflow

attrs.description: This attribute, when set to __1__, indicates to the chart that the text (rendered on the chart) may contain RTL characters and the textual display has to be managed accordingly.
attrs.name: hasRTLText

attrs.description: This attribute changes the theme of the chart. There are 7 types of themes which have been made according to the different color combinations.
attrs.name: theme

description: These attributes let you control a variety of functional elements on the chart. For example, you can opt to show/hide data labels, data values. You can also set chart limits and extended properties.

attrs.description: This attribute allows to set a custom font for all chart messages.
attrs.name: baseChartMessageFont

attrs.description: This attribute allows to set a custom font size for all chart messages.
attrs.name: baseChartMessageFontSize

attrs.description: This attribute allows to set a custom font color for all chart messages.
attrs.name: baseChartMessageColor

attrs.description:
This attribute allows to set a custom horizontal alignment for all images displayed as chart messages. 

Default value: middle
attrs.name: baseChartMessageImageHAlign

attrs.description:
This attribute allows to set a custom vertical alignment for all images displayed as chart messages. 

Default value: middle
attrs.name: baseChartMessageImageVAlign

attrs.description:
This attribute allows to set a transparency for all images displayed as chart messages. 

Default value: 100
attrs.name: baseChartMessageImageAlpha

attrs.description:
This attribute allows to set a scale for magnifying all images displayed as chart messages. 

Default value: 100
attrs.name: baseChartMessageImageScale

attrs.description: This attribute allows to set the message to be displayed when a chart begins to load. To display an image as the chart message, prefix __I-__ to the image URL.
attrs.name: loadMessage

attrs.description: This attribute allows to set the font for the message displayed when a chart begins to load.
attrs.name: loadMessageFont

attrs.description: This attribute allows to set the font size for the message displayed when a chart begins to load.
attrs.name: loadMessageFontSize

attrs.description: This attribute allows to set the font color for the message displayed when a chart begins to load.
attrs.name: loadMessageColor

attrs.description:
If an image is displayed as the chart `loadMessage`, this attribute allows to set a custom horizontal alignment for the image. 

Default value: value assigned to the `baseChartMessageImageHAlign` attribute
attrs.name: loadMessageImageHAlign

attrs.description:
If an image is displayed as the chart `loadMessage`, this attribute allows to set a custom vertical alignment for the image. 

Default value: value assigned to the `baseChartMessageImageVAlign` attribute
attrs.name: loadMessageImageVAlign

attrs.description:
If an image is displayed as the chart `loadMessage`, this attribute allows to set the transparency of the image. 

Default value: 100
attrs.name: loadMessageImageAlpha

attrs.description:
If an image is displayed as the chart `loadMessage`, this attribute allows to set the scale for magnifying the image. 

Default value: 100
attrs.name: loadMessageImageScale

attrs.description: This attribute allows to set the message to be displayed when the specified chart type is not supported. To display an image as the chart message, prefix __I-__ to the image URL.
attrs.name: typeNotSupportedMessage

attrs.description: This attribute allows to set the font for the message displayed when the specified chart type is not supported.
attrs.name: typeNotSupportedMessageFont

attrs.description: This attribute allows to set the font size for the message displayed when the specified chart type is not supported.
attrs.name: typeNotSupportedMessageFontSize

attrs.description: This attribute allows to set the font color for the message displayed when the specified chart type is not supported.
attrs.name: typeNotSupportedMessageColor

attrs.description:
If an image is displayed as the chart `typeNotSupportedMessage`, this attribute allows to set a custom horizontal alignment for the image. 

Default value: value assigned to the `baseChartMessageImageHAlign` attribute
attrs.name: typeNotSupportedMessageImageHAlign

attrs.description:
If an image is displayed as the chart `typeNotSupportedMessage`, this attribute allows to set a custom vertical alignment for the image. 

Default value: value assigned to the `baseChartMessageImageVAlign` attribute
attrs.name: typeNotSupportedMessageImageVAlign

attrs.description:
If an image is displayed as the chart `typeNotSupportedMessage`, this attribute allows to set the transparency of the image. 

Default value: 100
attrs.name: typeNotSupportedMessageImageAlpha

attrs.description:
If an image is displayed as the chart `typeNotSupportedMessage`, this attribute allows to set the scale for magnifying the image. 

Default value: 100
attrs.name: typeNotSupportedMessageImageScale

attrs.description: This attribute allows to set the message to be displayed if an error is encountered while rendering the chart. To display an image as the chart message, prefix __I-__ to the image URL.
attrs.name: renderErrorMessage

attrs.description: This attribute allows to set a font for the message displayed if an error is encountered while rendering the chart.
attrs.name: renderErrorMessageFont

attrs.description: This attribute allows to set the font size for the message displayed if an error is encountered while rendering the chart.
attrs.name: renderErrorMessageFontSize

attrs.description: This attribute allows to set the font color for the message displayed if an error is encountered while rendering the chart.
attrs.name: renderErrorMessageColor

attrs.description:
If an image is displayed as the chart `renderErrorMessage`, this attribute allows to set a custom horizontal alignment for the image. 

Default value: value assigned to the `baseChartMessageImageHAlign` attribute
attrs.name: renderErrorMessageImageHAlign

attrs.description:
If an image is displayed as the chart `renderErrorMessage`, this attribute allows to set a custom vertical alignment for the image. 

Default value: value assigned to the `baseChartMessageImageVAlign` attribute
attrs.name: renderErrorMessageImageVAlign

attrs.description:
If an image is displayed as the chart `renderErrorMessage`, this attribute allows to set the transparency of the image. 

Default value: 100
attrs.name: renderErrorMessageImageAlpha

attrs.description:
If an image is displayed as the chart `renderErrorMessage`, this attribute allows to set the scale for magnifying the image. 

Default value: 100
attrs.name: renderErrorMessageImageScale

attrs.description: This attribute allows to set the message to be displayed when chart data begins loading. To display an image as the chart message, prefix __I-__ to the image URL.
attrs.name: dataLoadStartMessage

attrs.description: This attribute allows to set a font for the message displayed when chart data begins loading.
attrs.name: dataLoadStartMessageFont

attrs.description: This attribute allows to set the font size for the message displayed when chart data begins loading.
attrs.name: dataLoadStartMessageFontSize

attrs.description: This attribute allows to set the font color for the message displayed when chart data begins loading.
attrs.name: dataLoadStartMessageColor

attrs.description:
If an image is displayed as the chart `dataLoadStartMessage`, this attribute allows to set a custom horizontal alignment for the image. 

Default value: value assigned to the `baseChartMessageImageHAlign` attribute
attrs.name: dataLoadStartMessageImageHAlign

attrs.description:
If an image is displayed as the chart `dataLoadStartMessage`, this attribute allows to set a custom vertical alignment for the image. 

Default value: value assigned to the `baseChartMessageImageVAlign` attribute
attrs.name: dataLoadStartMessageImageVAlign

attrs.description:
If an image is displayed as the chart `dataLoadStartMessage`, this attribute allows to set the transparency of the image. 

Default value: 100
attrs.name: dataLoadStartMessageImageAlpha

attrs.description:
If an image is displayed as the chart `dataLoadStartMessage`, this attribute allows to set the scale for magnifying the image. 

Default value: 100
attrs.name: dataLoadStartMessageImageScale

attrs.description: This attribute allows to set the message to be displayed if an error is encountered while loading chart data. To display an image as the chart message, prefix __I-__ to the image URL.
attrs.name: dataLoadErrorMessage

attrs.description: This attribute allows to set a font for the message displayed if an error is encountered while loading chart data.
attrs.name: dataLoadErrorMessageFont

attrs.description: This attribute allows to set the font size for the message displayed if an error is encountered while loading chart data.
attrs.name: dataLoadErrorMessageFontSize

attrs.description: This attribute allows to set the font color for the message displayed if an error is encountered while loading chart data.
attrs.name: dataLoadErrorMessageColor

attrs.description:
If an image is displayed as the chart `dataLoadErrorMessage`, this attribute allows to set a custom horizontal alignment for the image. 

Default value: value assigned to the `baseChartMessageImageHAlign` attribute
attrs.name: dataLoadErrorMessageImageHAlign

attrs.description:
If an image is displayed as the chart `dataLoadErrorMessage`, this attribute allows to set a custom vertical alignment for the image. 

Default value: value assigned to the `baseChartMessageImageVAlign` attribute
attrs.name: dataLoadErrorMessageImageVAlign

attrs.description:
If an image is displayed as the chart `dataLoadErrorMessage`, this attribute allows to set the transparency of the image. 

Default value: 100
attrs.name: dataLoadErrorMessageImageAlpha

attrs.description:
If an image is displayed as the chart `dataLoadErrorMessage`, this attribute allows to set the scale for magnifying the image. 

Default value: 100
attrs.name: dataLoadErrorMessageImageScale

attrs.description: This attribute allows to set the message to be displayed if the data to be loaded for the chart is invalid. To display an image as the chart message, prefix __I-__ to the image URL.
attrs.name: dataInvalidMessage

attrs.description: This attribute allows to set the font for the message displayed if the specified chart data is invalid.
attrs.name: dataInvalidMessageFont

attrs.description: This attribute allows to set the font size for the message displayed if the specified chart data is invalid.
attrs.name: dataInvalidMessageFontSize

attrs.description: This attribute allows to set the font color for the message displayed if the specified chart data is invalid.
attrs.name: dataInvalidMessageColor

attrs.description:
If an image is displayed as the chart `dataInvalidMessage`, this attribute allows to set a custom horizontal alignment for the image. 

Default value: value assigned to the `baseChartMessageImageHAlign` attribute
attrs.name: dataInvalidMessageImageHAlign

attrs.description:
If an image is displayed as the chart `dataInvalidMessage`, this attribute allows to set a custom vertical alignment for the image. 

Default value: value assigned to the `baseChartMessageImageVAlign` attribute
attrs.name: dataInvalidMessageImageVAlign

attrs.description:
If an image is displayed as the chart `dataInvalidMessage`, this attribute allows to set the transparency of the image. 

Default value: 100
attrs.name: dataInvalidMessageImageAlpha

attrs.description:
If an image is displayed as the chart `dataInvalidMessage`, this attribute allows to set the scale for magnifying the image. 

Default value: 100
attrs.name: dataInvalidMessageImageScale

description: These attributes let you set and configure custom chart messages, using text as well as images. These attributes are supported in FusionCharts constructor (`FusionCharts({ })`).

attrs.description: This attribute lets you set whether the lower limit will be 0 (in case of all positive values on chart) or should the lower limit adapt itself to a different figure based on values provided to the chart.
attrs.name: setAdaptiveMin

attrs.description: This attribute helps you explicitly set the upper limit of the chart. If you don't specify this value, the chart automatically calculates the upper limit based on the data provided by you.
attrs.name: upperLimit

attrs.description: This attribute helps you explicitly set the lower limit of the chart.If you don't specify this value, the chart automatically calculates the lower limit based on the data provided by you.
attrs.name: lowerLimit

attrs.description: This attribute allows you to display a label instead of the lower limit. For example, in a chart displaying Literacy Rate on a scale of 0 - 100%, you may need to show the label Low at the starting point of the chart. Upon using this attribute to specify the label, the value 0 will be replaced by Low. Default value: If you do not specify the `lowerLimitDisplay` attribute, the lower limit value will be shown.
attrs.name: lowerLimitDisplay

attrs.description: This attribute allows you to display a label instead of the upper limit. Upon using this attribute, the upper limit of the chart gets replaced by the label specified. Default value: If you do not specify the `upperLimitDisplay` attribute, the upper limit value will be shown.
attrs.name: upperLimitDisplay

attrs.description: Whether to show tick marks?
attrs.name: showTickMarks

attrs.description: Whether to show tick values?
attrs.name: showTickValues

attrs.description: Whether to show the first and last tick value (i.e., chart lower and upper limit)?
attrs.name: showLimits

attrs.description: Whether to adjust major tick mark number so as to best distribute the specified chart scale.
attrs.name: adjustTM

attrs.description: Whether to show ticks on the left or right side of gauge?
attrs.name: ticksOnRight

attrs.description: Number of major tick marks.
attrs.name: majorTMNumber

attrs.description: Major tick marks color.
attrs.name: majorTMColor

attrs.description: Major tick marks alpha.
attrs.name: majorTMAlpha

attrs.description: Width of major tick marks.
attrs.name: majorTMHeight

attrs.description: Thickness of major tick mark line.
attrs.name: majorTMThickness

attrs.description: Number of minor tick marks.
attrs.name: minorTMNumber

attrs.description: Color of minor tick marks.
attrs.name: minorTMColor

attrs.description: Alpha of minor tick marks.
attrs.name: minorTMAlpha

attrs.description: Width of minor tick marks.
attrs.name: minorTMHeight

attrs.description: Thickness of minor tick marks.
attrs.name: minorTMThickness

attrs.description: Distance between the gauge scale and tick marks.
attrs.name: tickMarkDistance

attrs.description: Distance between tick values and tick marks.
attrs.name: tickValueDistance

attrs.description: If you need to show every n-th tick value only, you can specify that value here.
attrs.name: tickValueStep

attrs.description: Number of decimals to which tick values will be rounded to.
attrs.name: tickValueDecimals

attrs.description: Whether to force number of decimals on tick values?
attrs.name: forceTickValueDecimals

description: The following attributes configures the Axis and the tick marks on the chart.

attrs.description: This parameter sets the path of the page which is supposed to relay real-time data to the chart. If you've special characters as a part of your data stream URL, like ? or &, you'll need to URL Encode the entire `dataStreamURL``.` This page needs to be on the same sub-domain on which the chart is hosted and invoked from.
attrs.name: dataStreamURL

attrs.description: For this parameter, you can specify the number of seconds after which the chart will look for new data. This process will happen continuously - i.e., if you specify 5 seconds here, the chart will look for new data every 5 seconds.
attrs.name: refreshInterval

attrs.description: Constantly changing data stamp that can be added to real time Data URL, so as to maintain a state. Please see the section Real time capabilities > Adding data stamp
attrs.name: dataStamp

attrs.description: Whether to show the real-time update related menu items (like Start/Stop Update) in chart's context menu? Note: For JavaScript charts real-time update related menu items do not appear by default. You need to explicitly set the `'showRTMenuItem': '1'` in the `chart` object. The menu appears as a button on the bottom-left corner of the JavaScript chart. You can then use the button to Start/Stop Update or Clear chart.
attrs.name: showRTMenuItem

description: Using these attributes, you can configure the real-time feature.

attrs.description: If you want to explicitly specify a radius for thermometer bulb, you can use this attribute. Else, FusionWidgets XT automatically calculates the best possible value.
attrs.name: thmBulbRadius

attrs.description: This attribute sets the height of the scale for the thermometer.
attrs.name: thmHeight

attrs.description: Sets the color of thermometer.
attrs.name: thmfillcolor

attrs.description: Sets the color of thermometer’s glass.
attrs.name: thmGlassColor

attrs.description: Fill color for thermometer.
attrs.name: gaugeFillColor

attrs.description: Fill alpha for thermometer.
attrs.name: gaugeFillAlpha

attrs.description: Whether to show a border around thermometer?
attrs.name: showGaugeBorder

attrs.description: Color of thermometer border.
attrs.name: gaugeBorderColor

attrs.description: Thickness of thermometer border.
attrs.name: gaugeBorderThickness

attrs.description: Alpha of thermometer border.
attrs.name: gaugeBorderAlpha

description: The following attributes let you control the thermometer properties:

attrs.description: Whether to use message logger for the chart?
attrs.name: useMessageLog

attrs.description: This attribute lets you set the width percent of the message logger window w.r.t entire chart width. So, if you set it as 80, the message logger window will take up 80% of chart width.
attrs.name: messageLogWPercent

attrs.description: This attribute lets you set the height percent of the message logger window w.r.t entire chart height.
attrs.name: messageLogHPercent

attrs.description: Whether to show the title for message logger?
attrs.name: messageLogShowTitle

attrs.description: If you've opted to show the title for message logger, you can define your custom title here. Examples are "Error log", "Server History" etc. The title displays at the top left corner of chart.
attrs.name: messageLogTitle

attrs.description: You can customize the color of the entire message log window by setting a hex value for this attribute.
attrs.name: messageLogColor

attrs.description: The messages streamed to the chart can either be displayed in the message log window or can be passed to JavaScript (which we'll see next). This attribute lets you control whether the messages should be logged in the in-built log window.
attrs.name: messageGoesToLog

attrs.description: This attribute lets you configure whether each message streamed from the server should be passed to a local JavaScript function.
attrs.name: messageGoesToJS

attrs.description: If you've opted to pass each message to JavaScript function, this attribute lets you define the name of the function. This helps you create your custom functions to react to messages streamed from server.
attrs.name: messageJSHandler

attrs.description: Whether to pass all message envelope parameters to the custom JavaScript function.
attrs.name: messagePassAllToJS

description: FusionWidgets XT uses the concept of streaming and showing real-time messages in the chart using Message Logger. The Message logger can be effectively used to show necessary real-time information or live error logs.

attrs.description: This configuration determines whether the numbers displayed on the chart will be formatted using commas, e.g., 40,000 if 'formatNumber': '1'; and 40000 if 'formatNumber': '0';.
attrs.name: formatNumber

attrs.description: Using this attribute, you could add prefix to all the numbers visible on the graph. For example, to represent all dollars figure on the chart, you could specify this attribute to $ to show like $40000, $50000.
attrs.name: numberPrefix

attrs.description: Using this attribute, you could add suffix to all the numbers visible on the graph. For example, to represent all figures quantified as per annum on the chart, you could specify this attribute to '/a' to show like 40000/a, 50000/a.
attrs.name: numberSuffix

attrs.description: Number of decimal places to which all numbers on the chart will be rounded to.
attrs.name: decimals

attrs.description: Whether to add 0 padding at the end of decimal numbers? For example, if you set decimals as 2 and a number is 23.4. If `forceDecimals` is set to 1, the number will automatically be converted to 23.40 (note the extra 0 at the end).
attrs.name: forceDecimals

attrs.description: Configuration whether to add K (thousands) and M (millions) to a number after truncating and rounding it - e.g., if `formatNumberScale` is set to 1, 1043 will become 1.04K (with decimals set to 2 places). Same with numbers in millions - an M will be added at the end.
attrs.name: formatNumberScale

attrs.description: The default unit of the numbers that you're providing to the chart.
attrs.name: defaultNumberScale

attrs.description: Unit of each block of the scale.
attrs.name: numberScaleUnit

attrs.description: Range of the various blocks that constitute the scale.
attrs.name: numberScaleValue

attrs.description:
If a data value is less than the lowest given number is the number scale, this attribute forces the lower value of the  `numberScaleUnit` to be applied to that data value.  This attribute works only when `“formatNumberScale”: “1”` and the `defaultNumberScale` attribute is not defined. 

For example, if `“numberScaleUnit”: “K, M”`, `“numberScaleValue”: “1000, 1000”`, and `“forceNumberScale”: “1”`, a data value of __400__ will be rendered as __0.40K__.
attrs.name: forceNumberScale

attrs.description: Whether recursive scaling should be applied.
attrs.name: scaleRecursively

attrs.description: How many recursions to complete during recursive scaling? -1 completes the entire set of recursion.
attrs.name: maxScaleRecursion

attrs.description: What character to use to separate the scales that are generated after recursion?
attrs.name: scaleSeparator

attrs.description: This attribute helps you specify the character to be used as the decimal separator in a number.
attrs.name: decimalSeparator

attrs.description: This attribute helps you specify the character to be used as the thousands separator in a number.
attrs.name: thousandSeparator

attrs.description: This option helps you specify the position of the thousand separator.
attrs.name: thousandSeparatorPosition

attrs.description: In some countries, commas are used as decimal separators and dots as thousand separators. In XML, if you specify such values, it will give an error while converting to number. The chart accepts the input decimal and thousand separator from user, so that it can convert it accordingly into the required format. This attribute lets you input the decimal separator.
attrs.name: inDecimalSeparator

attrs.description: In some countries, commas are used as decimal separators and dots as thousand separators. In XML, if you specify such values, it will give an error while converting to number. The chart accepts the input decimal and thousand separator from user, so that it can convert it accordingly into the required format. This attribute lets you input the thousand separator.
attrs.name: inThousandSeparator

description: Using the attributes below, you can control a myriad of options like: Formatting of commas and decimals Number prefixes and suffixes Decimal places to which the numbers will round to Scaling of numbers based on a user defined scale Custom number input formats

attrs.description: This attribute sets the background color for the chart. You can set any hex color code as the value of this attribute. To specify a gradient as background color, separate the hex color codes of each color in the gradient using comma. Example: `#FF5904, #FFFFFF`.
attrs.name: bgColor

attrs.description: Sets the alpha (transparency) for the background. If you've opted for gradient background, you need to set a list of alpha(s) separated by comma.
attrs.name: bgAlpha

attrs.description: If you've opted for a gradient background, this attribute lets you set the ratio of each color constituent.
attrs.name: bgRatio

attrs.description: Angle of the background color, in case of a gradient.
attrs.name: bgAngle

attrs.description: Whether to show a border around the chart or not?
attrs.name: showBorder

attrs.description: Border color of the chart.
attrs.name: borderColor

attrs.description: Border thickness of the chart.
attrs.name: borderThickness

attrs.description: Border alpha of the chart.
attrs.name: borderAlpha

attrs.description: To place any image (JPG/PNG/GIF) as background of the chart, enter the (path and) name of the background image. It should be in the same domain as the chart.
attrs.name: bgImage

attrs.description: This attribute specifies the opacity for the loaded background image.
attrs.name: bgImageAlpha

attrs.description: Helps you specify the mode in which the background image is to be displayed. Stretch - expands the image to fit the entire chart area, without maintaining original image constraints. Tile - the image is repeated as a pattern on the entire chart area. Fit - fits the image proportionately on the chart area. Fill -proportionately fills the entire chart area with the image. Center - the image is positioned at the center of the chart area. None - Default mode.
attrs.name: bgImageDisplayMode

attrs.description: Helps you to vertically align the background image.
attrs.name: bgImageVAlign

attrs.description: Helps you to horizontally align the background image.
attrs.name: bgImageHAlign

attrs.description: Helps you magnify the background image.This attribute will only work when the attribute `bgImageDisplayMode` is set to none, center, or tile.
attrs.name: bgImageScale

attrs.description: You can load an external logo (JPEG/PNG) to your chart, this attribute lets you specify the URL. Due to cross domain security restrictions it is advised to use a logo from the same domain name as your charts.
attrs.name: logoURL

attrs.description: This attribute helps you set the amount of empty space that you want to put on the left side of your logo image. Nothing is rendered in this space.
attrs.name: logoLeftMargin

attrs.description: This attribute helps you set the amount of empty space that you want to put on top of your logo image. Nothing is rendered in this space.
attrs.name: logoTopMargin

attrs.description: Where to position the logo on the chart: TL - Top-left TR - Top-right BR - Bottom right BL - Bottom left CC - Center of screen
attrs.name: logoPosition

attrs.description: Once the logo has loaded on the chart, you can configure its opacity using this attribute.
attrs.name: logoAlpha

attrs.description: You can also change the size of externally loaded logo at run-time by specifying a value for this parameter.
attrs.name: logoScale

attrs.description: If you want to link the logo to an external URL, specify the link in this attribute. The link can be in FusionCharts link format, allowing you to link to new windows, pop-ups, frames etc.
attrs.name: logoLink

description: The following attributes let you configure chart cosmetics like background color, background alpha, canvas color & alpha etc.

attrs.description: Sets the font of the values in the chart
attrs.name: valueFont

attrs.description: Specifies the value font color
attrs.name: valueFontColor

attrs.description: Specifies the value font size
attrs.name: valueFontSize

attrs.description: Whether value font should be bold
attrs.name: valueFontBold

attrs.description: Whether value font should be italicized
attrs.name: valueFontItalic

attrs.description: Sets the background color for value text
attrs.name: valueBgColor

attrs.description: Sets the border color around the value text
attrs.name: valueBorderColor

attrs.description: Sets the value alpha including font and background
attrs.name: valueAlpha

attrs.description: Sets the value font alpha
attrs.name: valueFontAlpha

attrs.description: Sets the value background alpha
attrs.name: valueBgAlpha

attrs.description: Sets the value border alpha
attrs.name: valueBorderAlpha

attrs.description: Sets the value border thickness
attrs.name: valueBorderThickness

attrs.description: Sets the padding between the value and its surrounding border
attrs.name: valueBorderPadding

attrs.description: Sets the value border radius
attrs.name: valueBorderRadius

attrs.description:
Whether the border around the data values should be rendered using dashed lines. 

__Default value__: 0 (border rendered using straight lines)
attrs.name: valueBorderDashed

attrs.description: Sets the length of each dash when the border around the data values is rendered using dashed lines.
attrs.name: valueBorderDashLen

attrs.description: Sets the gap between two consecutive dashes when the border around the data values is rendered using dashed lines.
attrs.name: valueBorderDashGap

attrs.description:
Set this attribute to `1` to draw a border on the data value text. 

Default value: 0
attrs.name: textOutline

description: These attributes let you configure font, background and border cosmetics, of value text-field that appear for each data plot.

attrs.description: This attribute lets you set the font face (family) of all the text (data labels, values etc.) on chart. If you specify the `outCnvBaseFont` attribute also, then this attribute controls only the font face of text within the chart canvas bounds.
attrs.name: baseFont

attrs.description: This attribute sets the base font size of the chart i.e., all the values and the names in the chart which lie on the canvas will be displayed using the font size provided here.
attrs.name: baseFontSize

attrs.description: This attribute sets the base font color of the chart i.e., all the values and the names in the chart which lie on the canvas will be displayed using the font color provided here.
attrs.name: baseFontColor

description: Using the attributes below, you can define the generic font properties for all the text on the chart. These attributes allow you a high level control over font properties. If you intend to specify font properties for individual chart elements (like Caption, sub-caption etc.), you'll need to use the Styles feature. Using Styles, you can also specify advanced font properties like Bold, Italics, HTML Mode etc. Using Styles you can also configure real-time values.

attrs.description: Whether to show tooltip for the annotations?
attrs.name: showToolTip

attrs.description: Background color for the tooltip
attrs.name: toolTipBgColor

attrs.description: Font color for the tool-tip.
attrs.name: toolTipColor

attrs.description: Border Color for the tooltip.
attrs.name: toolTipBorderColor

attrs.description: Sets the border transparency for tool tip.
attrs.name: tooltipBorderAlpha

attrs.description: Whether to show shadow for tooltips.
attrs.name: showToolTipShadow

attrs.description:
Specify custom text for the tooltip 

 You can either specify a constant string as the tooltip text or you can use variable values from the data level by prefixing a __$__ to the attribute name, for example, __$name__, __$value__.
attrs.name: plottooltext

description: These attributes let you control the tooltip. You can set the background color, border color, separator character and few other details.

attrs.description: Where to position the toolbar on the chart: TL - Top-left TR - Top-right BR - Bottom right BL - Bottom left CC - Center of screen
attrs.name: toolbarPosition

attrs.description: Sets the toolbox position on the chart with respect to x-axis.
attrs.name: toolbarX

attrs.description: Sets the toolbox position on the chart with respect to y-axis.
attrs.name: toolbarY

attrs.description: Sets the horizontal alignment of the toolbar on the chart.
attrs.name: toolbarHAlign

attrs.description: Sets the vertical alignment of the toolbar on the chart
attrs.name: toolbarVAlign

attrs.description: Sets the color of the toolbar buttons.
attrs.name: toolbarButtonColor

attrs.description: Enables/disables display of tooltips for toolbar buttons.
attrs.name: showToolBarButtonTooltext

attrs.description: You can change the scale of the toolbar by specifying a value for this attribute.
attrs.name: toolbarButtonScale

description: Using this set of attributes, you can customize the toolbar on the chart. The advantage of having a toolbar is that it manages all the UI action elements (context menus, checkboxes, buttons) centrally. This provides a clean, uniform look and a better, more meaningful and logical grouping.

attrs.description:
Whether the chart will allow exporting to images, PDFs, SVG or XLSX.  

__Default value__: 0
attrs.name: exportEnabled

attrs.description:
In case of server-side exporting, the action specifies whether the exported image will be sent back to client as download, or whether it'll be saved on the server. 

__Default value__: download
attrs.name: exportAction

attrs.description: In case of server side exporting, this refers to the path of the server-side export handler (the ready-to-use scripts that we provide).
attrs.name: exportHandler

attrs.description: Lets you configure what output formats to allow for export of chart, in the export context menu, and also customize the label for each menu item. The attribute value should be a pipe (|) delimited separated key-value pair. Example: `exportFormats: 'PNG=Export as High Quality Image|JPG|PDF=Export as PDF File'`
attrs.name: exportFormats

attrs.description:
This attributes sets the modes of export. To enable client-side exporting, set this attribute to __client__. 

__Default value__: auto. 

__Note__: Starting v3.12.1, the `exportMode` attribute replaces the `exportAtClientSide` attribute. However, you don’t need to make any changes to the existing setup because, the FusionCharts library comes with the proper mapping already provided.
attrs.name: exportMode

attrs.description: Whether the menu items related to export (e.g., Save as JPEG etc.) will appear in the context menu of chart.
attrs.name: exportShowMenuItem

attrs.description:
In case of server-side exporting and when using download as action, this lefts you configure whether the return image, PDF, SVG or XLSX will open in same window (as an attachment for download), or whether it will open in a new window. 

__Default value__: _self
attrs.name: exportTargetWindow

attrs.description: Using this attribute you can specify the name (excluding the extension) of the output (export) file.
attrs.name: exportFileName

description: These attributes allow you to control the saving of chart as image, SVG or XLSX.

attrs.description: Whether to enable hover effect on charts for all elements
attrs.name: showHoverEffect

attrs.description: Whether to enable hover effect on charts for data plots (e.g., column, pie) only
attrs.name: plotHoverEffect

attrs.description: Specifies the hover color for the data plots
attrs.name: plotFillHoverColor

attrs.description: Specifies the hover alpha for data plots
attrs.name: plotFillHoverAlpha

attrs.description: This attribute sets the thermometer fill color when hovered.
attrs.name: thmFillHoverColor

attrs.description: This attribute sets the thermometer fill transparency  when hovered.
attrs.name: thmFillHoverAlpha

description: If you wish to show an effect on the data plot (column, line anchor, pie etc.) when the user hovers his mouse over the data plot, these attributes let you configure the cosmetics of the hover for all data plots in the chart.

attrs.description: Amount of empty space that you want to put on the left side of your chart. Nothing is rendered in this space.
attrs.name: chartLeftMargin

attrs.description: Amount of empty space that you want to put on the right side of your chart. Nothing is rendered in this space.
attrs.name: chartRightMargin

attrs.description: Amount of empty space that you want to put on the top of your chart. Nothing is rendered in this space.
attrs.name: chartTopMargin

attrs.description: Amount of empty space that you want to put at the bottom of your chart. Nothing is rendered in this space.
attrs.name: chartBottomMargin

attrs.description: Distance between the value and gauge.
attrs.name: valuePadding

description: The following attributes help you control chart margins and paddings. FusionWidgets XT allows you manually customize the padding of various elements on the chart to allow advanced manipulation and control over chart visualization. Padding in FusionWidgets XT is always defined in pixels, unless the attribute itself suggests some other scale (like `plotSpacePercent`, which configures the spacing using percentage values). You can also define the chart margins. Chart Margins refer to the empty space left on the top, bottom, left and right of the chart. It is not necessary for you to specify any padding/margin values. FusionCharts Suite XT automatically assumes the best values for the same, if you do not specify the same.
